channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: Bandcampは、SongtradrがEpic Gamesから買収した数週間後に、従業員の約50％にあたる58人を解雇した（Stephen Council/SFGATE）
item.description:
Stephen Council / SFGATE:
Bandcamp lays off about 50% of its workforce, or 58 employees, just weeks after the company was acquired by Songtradr from Epic Games  —  Bandcamp built a unique music business: profitable and good for artists with a popular editorial arm.  Now, half the employees at the Bay Area firm are losing their jobs …

item.title: 2023年1月の広告規制緩和後、Xは政治広告主への積極的な働きかけを開始、アドインパクト：2024年の米選挙に向けて～12億ドルがデジタルで使われる（Patrick Coffee/Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Patrick Coffee / Wall Street Journal:
After relaxing ad rules in January 2023, X begins aggressively pitching political advertisers; AdImpact: ~$1.2B will be spent digitally for the 2024 US election  —  Musk's volatile leadership of the social-media platform has pushed down its prices—which might give it an edge

item.title: The Daily Wire、ディズニー100周年で子供向け年額99ドルのストリーミングアプリ「Bentkey」デビュー、2022年には3年間で1億ドル以上の投資を計画（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
The Daily Wire debuts Bentkey, a $99/year streaming app for kids, on Disney's 100th anniversary; in 2022, the outlet planned to invest $100M+ over three years  —  The Daily Wire, a conservative media brand known for its popular podcast “The Ben Shapiro show,” has debuted …

item.title: YouTubeがSpotlight Momentsを追加、ブランドがアカデミー賞のような文化的瞬間に関連する最も人気のあるYouTube動画を特定するためのAI搭載広告ツール（Sarah Perez/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Sarah Perez / TechCrunch:
YouTube adds Spotlight Moments, an AI-powered ad tool meant to help brands identify the most popular YouTube videos related to a cultural moment like the Oscars  —  YouTube is putting Google AI to use for advertisers, the company announced this morning with the introduction of a new advertising package called “Spotlight Moments.”

item.title: ネットフリックスのゲーム化推進、情報筋が詳報：「イカゲーム」や「水曜どうでしょう」など、番組を題材にしたゲームの増加、GTAゲームの議論など（ウォール・ストリート・ジャーナル紙）
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
Sources detail Netflix's deepening gaming push: more games based on its shows, including Squid Game and Wednesday, discussions about a GTA game, and more  —  Streamer to put greater emphasis on developing games based on its popular programming, including ‘Squid Game,’ ‘Wednesday,’ ‘Black Mirror’

item.title: ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙がグーグルの独占禁止法裁判を公開するよう申し立て、ブルームバーグ、ウォール・ストリート・ジャーナル、ニューヨーク・ポスト、MLex、Law360が支持（Nilay Patel/The Verge）
item.description:
Nilay Patel / The Verge:
The New York Times files a motion to open Google's antitrust trial to the public, backed by Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, New York Post, MLex, and Law360  —  You would barely know Google is in the middle of one of the most consequential antitrust trials in decades right now.

item.title: テイラー・スウィフトThe Eras Tour』は、アメリカとカナダの3,855館で公開され、週末興行収入は推定9,500万ドルから9,700万ドルとなり、業界を大いに盛り上げた（Nicole Sperling/New York Times）。
item.description:
Nicole Sperling / New York Times:
Taylor Swift: The Eras Tour grossed an estimated $95M to $97M on its opening weekend in the US and Canada across 3,855 theaters, a big boost to the industry  —  The movie made an estimated $95 million in ticket sales in the U.S. and Canada, giving a big boost to theaters suffering from strike-related delays.

item.title: Spotify、ユーザーのリスニング習慣に基づいておすすめのグッズを提供するアプリ内Merch Hubをローンチ、グッズはShopifyが運営するアーティストのストアで販売される（Aisha Malik/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Aisha Malik / TechCrunch:
Spotify launches an in-app Merch Hub that provides merch recommendations based on users' listening habits; merch is sold on artists' stores powered by Shopify  —  Spotify is launching a dedicated in-app Merch Hub that provides personalized merch recommendations based on your listening habits, the company announced on Monday.

item.title: イスラエル通信相、アルジャジーラ現地支局の閉鎖を求める、同ネットワークがハマス派を扇動し兵士を攻撃にさらしていると非難（ロイター）
item.description:
Reuters:
Israel's communications minister seeks the closure of Al Jazeera's local bureau, accusing the network of pro-Hamas incitement and exposing soldiers to attacks  —  Israel's communications minister said on Sunday he was seeking a possible closure of Al Jazeera's local bureau …

item.title: BBCがエジプトやレバノンなど中東を拠点とする6人の記者を放送から外し、親パレスチナ派のソーシャルメディアへの投稿について調査を開始（フィナンシャル・タイムズ紙）
item.description:
Financial Times:
The BBC takes six reporters based in the Middle East, including Egypt and Lebanon, off air and launches an investigation over pro-Palestine social media posts  —  Guardian decides not to renew contract of veteran cartoonist Steve Bell after image featuring Israeli PM was pulled

item.title: NBCニュースは、セーラム・ラジオ・ネットワークおよび共和党ユダヤ人連合と提携し、11月8日に共和党の第3回2024年大統領予備選討論会を開催する予定だ（Ken Meyer/Mediaite）
item.description:
Ken Meyer / Mediaite:
NBC News plans to host the GOP's third 2024 presidential primary debate on November 8, partnering with Salem Radio Network and the Republican Jewish Coalition  —  NBC News announced that they will host the Republican National Committee's third presidential primary debate at the Adrienne Arsht Center …

item.title: バークレイ一族は、UAEの投資家から融資を受け、テレグラフ・メディア・グループの価値を10億ポンドとするオファーを提示した。
item.description:
Mark Sweney / The Guardian:
The Barclay family tables an offer valuing The Telegraph Media Group at £1B in an attempt to deter rival bidders, after securing financing from UAE investors  —  Family that formerly controlled media group attempt to deter rival bidders with Abu Dhabi-backed offer

item.title: ガーディアン紙が40年ぶりに漫画家スティーブ・ベルを解雇、ベルによると同紙は先週、「反ユダヤ主義的な表現」を理由にベンヤミン・ネタニヤフ首相を描いた漫画を破棄したという。
item.description:
Press Gazette:
The Guardian sacks cartoonist Steve Bell after 40 years; Bell says the outlet last week spiked his cartoon of Benjamin Netanyahu citing “anti-Semitic tropes”  —  Bell stood by his controversial cartoon of the Israeli prime minister, saying: “I think it works.”

item.title: WBDは、春に北欧、イベリア、中東欧の22カ国で展開した後、2024年夏にフランスとベルギーでマックスを発売する予定だ（Elsa Keslassy/Variety）
item.description:
Elsa Keslassy / Variety:
WBD plans to launch Max in France and Belgium in summer 2024, after rolling out in 22 countries across the Nordics, Iberia, and Central Eastern Europe in spring  —  Warner Bros. Discovery will be launching its streaming service Max in France, one of its top European markets, next summer, Variety has learned.

item.title: 情報源：WSJのベテランスタッフが、イランがハマスの攻撃を「手助けした」という10月8日付の記事について懸念を表明した。
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
Sources: pre-publication, veteran WSJ staff raised concerns about an October 8 story that Iran “helped plan” Hamas' attacks; the piece had no Washington bylines  —  The News  —  The Wall Street Journal overrode some objections inside its own Washington bureau to publish an explosive …
